availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wilbur F. Oakley (Columbia County, New York, captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Married to Sarah A. Oakley. Father to Wilbur Oakley. Grocer in Columbia County, New York in 1860. Employed Mary Burke as a servant in Columbia County, New York in 1860. Served in 5th New York Infantry (U.S.A.) as quartermaster sergeant from October 31, 1861, Second Lieutenant from March 28,1864, First Lieutenant from November 14, 1864, and Captain from May 2, 1865. Died between February 1865 and November 9, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of New York for the Year 1894, vol. 2, (Albany: James B. Lyon, 1895), 240.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New York, Columbia, Hudson Ward 1, p. 844.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of New York, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M551, Roll 105.
